summary_points.title: Multi-Session Rally Extends Momentum
summary_points.summary: Indian equity indices marked their fourth and fifth consecutive daily gains, with the Sensex adding around 0.5–1% in recent sessions and the Nifty breaching significant levels. This sustained uptrend reflects healthy market breadth and continued institutional inflows supporting overall momentum.

summary_points.title: IT Stocks and Heavyweights Drive Gains
summary_points.summary: Leadership came from the IT sector, with Infosys jumping nearly 3.9% and TCS rising 2.7%, while heavyweights such as Reliance Industries and Tata Motors also contributed robust gains. These key constituents propelled the Nifty50 and Sensex higher across multiple sessions.

summary_points.title: IT Sector Powers Benchmark Gains
summary_points.summary: IT heavyweight stocks led the charge, driving both Nifty50 and Sensex to fresh highs. Infosys surged 3.88% and TCS climbed 2.69%, while other tech bellwethers such as HCL Tech and Tech Mahindra also posted strong gains, offsetting declines in select financial and auto names.

summary_points.title: Cautious Opening Amid Mixed Global Cues
summary_points.summary: Indian benchmarks are poised to start trading with marginal changes after mixed global signals. Gift Nifty suggests a flat to slightly lower open, mirroring declines in Asian markets and profit-taking in US tech stocks. Investors remain wary ahead of domestic policy developments and key economic data releases.

summary_points.title: Policy Reforms and Institutional Flows Bolster Confidence
summary_points.summary: Optimism is underpinned by anticipated GST reforms, a recent sovereign rating upgrade, and tailored sector-specific measures, alongside healthy institutional flows. These factors are expected to reinforce market stability and sustain investor confidence in the near term.

summary_points.title: Rally Streak Extends into Fifth Day
summary_points.summary: The domestic equity market extended its uptrend for a fourth consecutive session, with Sensex climbing 370.64 points (0.46%) to 81,644.39 and Nifty 50 rising 103.70 points (0.42%) to 24,980.65. Positive domestic momentum is supported by sector‐specific relief measures, policy support and strong institutional flows, underpinned by robust buying across key stocks.

articles.title: Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty end fifth straight positive session on IT gains
articles.snippet: The Sensex and Nifty closed higher for the fifth consecutive session, driven by strong IT sector performance.

articles.title: Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty end in green for fifth straight session
articles.snippet: Nifty50 rose 69.90 points to 25,050.55 and Sensex gained 213.45 points to 81,857.84, driven largely by strong IT sector gains such as Infosys and TCS.

articles.title: Sensex and Nifty 50 expected to open lower on Wednesday
articles.snippet: Weakness in Asian and US markets suggests a lower open for Indian equity benchmarks after four straight sessions of gains.

top_performing_sectors.explanation: Auto stocks saw strong buying interest, with heavyweight names like Maruti Suzuki, Hero MotoCorp and Tata Motors driving sector gains.
The Nifty Oil & Gas index led gains amid robust energy stock buying and easing concerns over higher crude prices.
Consumer durables shares rallied on optimism around proposed GST reforms and sustained consumer demand.

underperforming_sectors.explanation: IT stocks faced selling pressure and profit-booking in names like Tech Mahindra and HCL Tech, dragging the sector lower.
Power sector stocks underperformed as investors booked profits following recent advances.
Pharma was the only sector in negative territory, weighed down by declines in Dr. Reddy’s and Cipla.

gainers.reason: Led auto‐sector buying amid optimism over proposed GST reforms.
Rallied as investors cheered anticipated GST rationalisation benefiting financial stocks.
Climbed on strong realty‐sector support following GST reform hopes.

losers.reason: Underperformed amid selling pressure in consumer‐durables and broader sectoral rotation.
Slipped as IT‐sector names faced profit‐taking.
Declined on mixed sentiment in the IT space despite overall market gains.

market_drivers.summary: Indian equities extended gains, buoyed by a sharp rally in auto stocks—led by Ola Electric, Bajaj Auto, Hero MotoCorp and Maruti Suzuki—on speculation of a GST cut on vehicles and Chinese assurances over rare earth magnet supplies; a strong uptick in Reliance Industries following Jio’s prepaid tariff revamp and positive brokerage calls; expectations of broader GST reforms and a sovereign rating upgrade; robust institutional inflows underpinned by sector‐specific policy support; and positive global cues together sustained buying momentum across benchmarks.
